title: Charging Your Way: Stellantis Launches Free2move Charge to Make it 'Easy to Always Be Charged' - Stellantis
summary: Stellantis has launched Free2move Charge, a comprehensive ecosystem that provides EV charging and energy management solutions for customers. Free2move Charge offers a range of products and services, including home charging, business charging, and on-the-go charging, making it easy for customers to charge their EVs anywhere, anytime. Free2move Charge is part of Stellantis' Dare Forward 2030 strategic plan, which aims to achieve a 100% passenger car battery electric vehicle (BEV) sales mix in Europe and a 50% passenger car and light-duty truck BEV sales mix in the United States by 2030.
green_innovation: TRUE, Free2move Charge is a green innovation because it contributes to environmental sustainability by providing EV charging and energy management solutions that help to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE, Free2move Charge is a business innovation because it is a new and improved product or service that differs significantly from the firm's previous products or services.
green_product: TRUE, Free2move Charge Home delivers private customers support with installation, financing, and warranty of home charging and other energy hardware and services. Options can range from AC charging cables and wall boxes today to Vehicle-2-Home, Vehicle-2-Grid, and complete energy management systems with cutting-edge features like touch-free wireless solutions and inductive robot charging under development for future releases.
green_process: TRUE, Free2move Charge Business tackles all hurdles as a one-stop-shop platform with a full suite of charging and energy services: early-on support, estimation of initial and future running costs, right-sizing of charging infrastructure, installation, maintenance, and public charging access while on the go.
likely_naics_codes: ['336312 - Motor Vehicle Battery Manufacturing', '336322 - Other Motor Vehicle Electrical and Electronic Equipment Manufacturing', '336399 - All Other Motor Vehicle Parts Manufacturing', '562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Store Retailers (except Tobacco Stores)']
greenwashing: FALSE, Free2move Charge does not appear to be an example of greenwashing because it provides genuine environmental benefits by helping to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Strengthening Sustainable Building Operations | BCG - BCG
summary: Building operations contribute significantly to global emissions, and several stakeholders must collaborate to decarbonize this sector. Asset owners, OEMs, utility companies, and local regulators each have unique roles to play. By adopting energy efficiency and electrification measures, the building sector can work towards reaching net-zero emissions.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article describes technological solutions to reduce environmental impacts, such as district heating, heat pumps, and energy-efficient building materials.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the article describes new and improved building technologies that differ significantly from previous offerings, such as heat pumps, smart control systems, and optimized electricity consumption.
green_product: TRUE, because the article describes products that are designed to reduce their environmental impact throughout their life cycle, such as heat pumps, solar photovoltaic systems, and building insulation.
green_process: TRUE, because the article describes processes that are designed to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability, such as the use of renewable energy sources, recycling materials, and energy-efficient construction techniques.

title: Role of Emerging Technologies in Advancing Sustainability - Chemical Industry Digest
summary: The chemical industry is facing challenges related to environmental pollution, waste management, and sustainable practices. Emerging technologies like Artificial Intelligence (AI), Blockchain, Machine Learning (ML), Data Analytics, and Digitalization are powerful tools for enabling sustainability within the chemical industry. By adopting these technologies, chemical industries can improve supply chain management, traceability, efficiency, security, and waste management, and contribute to sustainability in various processes.
